meanings.definition: The fatty part of milk that rises to the top.
meanings.sent1: I poured the cream over my dessert.
meanings.sent2: The cream in the milkshake made it extra rich.
meanings.sent3: The cat licked the cream off the top of the milk.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as smooth as cream, soothing everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The cream on the soup looked like a delicate swirl of clouds.

meanings.definition: A thick liquid or semi-solid substance used in cooking or as a cosmetic.
meanings.sent1: She applied the cream to her face before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: The cake recipe called for a cup of heavy cream.
meanings.sent3: The cream smelled like fresh flowers, making her smile.
meanings.sent4: The cream oozed out of the tube like a slow-moving river.
meanings.sent5: The cream on the pie glistened under the sunlight, tempting everyone to take a bite.

meanings.definition: To beat or churn milk or cream to make it thicker.
meanings.sent1: I need to cream the butter and sugar for the cake.
meanings.sent2: She used a whisk to cream the ingredients together.
meanings.sent3: The machine whirred as it started to cream the milk.
meanings.sent4: He creamed the mixture until it was smooth and fluffy.
meanings.sent5: The chef showed us how to cream the sauce for the pasta dish.

meanings.sent1: The cream of the crop was chosen for the award.
meanings.sent2: She always aims for the cream of the opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The cream of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His performance was the cream of the entire show.
meanings.sent5: The cream of the book was the unexpected plot twist at the end.
